title: Revert BE to IP
body:
Rito really stuffed up with this patch, the only way you can get BE is by disenchanting champion shards that you get from capsules which u get by levelling up which takes longer and longer until you hit level 150, then it stays the same. If u get a champ shard of a specific champ u want then u won't even get any BE until you level up again. Now they've also removed rerolling, you have to disenchant a LOT of shards just to upgrade one. So the only way to QUICKLY get champions (quickly as in not 5 years wait) is to spend RP which, will be good for Rito, but for the average player, not so much.
This pretty much forces people to use RP which should be optional and you should be able to easily progress in game without spending money. 
Feelsbadman{{item:3070}} 

Upvote if you want the old IP system back.

Edit1: I'm not saying remove everything about the new system, keep the unlimited levels and the rewards for leveling up, but keep the old currency system. The new rewards system is good for keeping people playing the game and its amazing for people who have bought all the champions but for newer people it makes it really hard to afford champions, especially newly released ones.

> [{quoted}](name=DJ Akari,realm=NA,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=KsZvsY4T,comment-id=0002000200010001000000000002,timestamp=2018-08-16T22:54:50.109+0000)
>
> I get one champion for a month on a new system. Old system I get a new champion within a week.

Personally, I've not found this kind of difference between the old system and the new. I don't play LoL as much now (over the past year or two) as I did prior to that. Over the past month, I'd played a reasonable amount to go through the missions related to recent events (Pool Party, for example). In that time, I've managed to get from about ~6K BE to ~14.5K on my main, and from ~5K to ~10K on my smurf (though currently sitting at ~7.5K because I bought Gangplank). At *that* rate, I could easily earn one champion per month per account, or one champion per fortnight to put it more simply. If I were to play 6+ hours per day, I could double that rate easy, giving me, on average, one champion per week, and that's even considering that I keep more than a few of the champion shards I get on my smurf as I don't own the champs or already have a shard for them.

if you're only getting ~100BE per level, including what the champ shards could be disenchanted for, then that's a *big* deviation from the average (910BE per level), and honestly you might want to consider contacting Support to find out if it's bugged/glitched and/or not working properly for you.

I think it'd be a good idea as well to add some BE as a reward for finishing a match. In my opinion, it feels that the rewards from the new system are a bit delayed where you need to wait for an extra level if you are just 20 BE off a champ you desire in order to purchase it. I like how the old system allowed for instantaneous rewards where you could buy the champion you were thinking about playing all day as soon as you had enough IP. Its sort of turned into a kind of lootbox way of earning in game currency that tended to alienate me from other games that had that type of in game currency system. In addition, i'm not exactly happy with the idea that I need to disenchant the shard that I obtained in my loot box in order to get BE. Before, I could get a crate and save the shard while disenchanting any other shards I didn't want, while at the same time earning for a specific champ I wanted with IP from matches at the same time. I am not sure if i'm making sense but in other words, its like I was able to actively earn currency (IP) for a champ that I specifically desired while also earning BE from any chests that I got to unlock the champion shard I had in my loot. But now its as if I need to not only wait to get a chest which is my only source of ingame currency but I also "NEED" to disassemble anything that I even get from the chest to actually get enough blue essence to buy the champ from the store. Before I could have gotten both, 1 immediately with IP and one over time by building up blue essence. A suggestion for this would be to provide BE after every game in order to eliminate the need to disenchant every shard you get in order to obtain BE and that would enable us to both buy champs from the store with BE and unlock the champs given to us by the capsules from leveling up using the BE we earned in matches. Using this method, it gives the shards value by allowing us to purchase champs at a discounted price without needing to disenchant them to get in game currency, and we can also buy the specific champs that we desire immediately. Technically this would work tying both the loot and the ingame currency reward system by making both valuable as I read was the goal of the rework. I understand that we may be earning around the same BE as IP as before but the problem is we are sharing this BE with the loot system which before had its own currency. In other words, its slower than before to really unlock champions because we can't exactly keep the shards if we want to earn BE so we have to disenchant them. Before we could earn 1 champ passively (BE) and 1 champ actively (IP).  Thanks for reading {{summoner:30}}

Even though that was exaggerating, it is still a problem, as you can see in this forum. To sum up, I would suggest after the next update, to be able to reroll champs back AND receive IP/BE after each game, instead of after leveling up. You see, this would definitely help Riot as well cause after the recent changes, people may have vowed not to buy anything from your store with real money.

This way, by changing some things back, everyone will be happy with the way Riot is progressing and actually LISTENING to their players, unlike some other games. 

I see it as a win/win in any form :)
-ZeBooshDog

P.S
I did a quick calculation, and as of 9/11/17 4:50pm AEST time, 75% of the community agrees to changing to the ability to reroll, and receiving blue essence after every game.  Around 100 essence for a win and around 40 for a loss would be absolutely perfect!!!

How about this, instead of getting Blue Essence after every game, have something new like Essence Points.
Like if riot make it so that you gain Essence Points after every game, once you gained 100 Essence Points or more, you get five times the Blue Essence from that much points, e.g, 100x5=500, once you gained 200 Essence Points or more, you get ten times the Blue Essence from that much points, once you gained 300 Essence Points or more, you get fifteen times the Blue Essence from that much Essence Points, once you gained 400 Essence Points or more, you get twenty times the Blue Essence from that much points, once you gained 500 Essence Points or more, you get twenty five times the Blue Essence from that much points.
If you have gained 500 Essence Points or more, you have reached the limit, and you cannot gain any more Essence Points until 14 days later/30 days later. After 14 days/30 days, Essence Points will reset itself and you can start the process over again.

Note: Essence Points is not a form of currency that you can use to purchase anything, it is something that will help you earn Blue Essence.

Tutorial and Training mode does not give you Essence Points.
Custom mode does not give you Essence Points even if you play with other players and both sides are even.
Intro bots mode does not give you Essence Points, regardless of whether you win or lose.
Beginner bots gives you 2 Essence Points per minute, and if you lose the game, you lose 25% of the total Essence Points, if you win, you get as much as the time you have spent to play the game.
Intermediate bots gives you 4 Essence Points per minute, if you lose the game, you lose 15% of the total Essence Points you would get by winning.
ARAM game gives you 3 Essence Points per minute, if you lose the game, you lose 20% of the total Essence Points you would get by winning.
All PVP Summonor's rift, whether Normal or Ranked, gives you 10 Essence Points per minute, and if you lose the game, you lose 10% of the total Essence Points you would get by winning.
All rotating Game mode will give you 7 Essence Points per minute, if you lose the game, you lose 15% of the total Essence Points you would get by winning.

I said this because I don't think it is necessary to get Blue Essence after every game, since every time you level up, you get chest that contains shards and Blue Essence anyway.

The way to earn Essence Points is not hard at all, it is just that you only get Blue Essence once you reached certain number of Essence Points

I don't know if this idea is stupid or not, tell me if you are not satisfied with this idea.

This feature is only a suggestion, and it does not have to be implemented.

Most "people" want an instant gratification and EXP is not it.  People judge of the "feel" of the game.  The new patch does not feel friendly.  Any solo or MMO you play, you don't care about experience, you want items, you want drops, OR, you are grinding to get to End Game Content.  How often have you been in lane and missed 6 minions in a row and said, "Oh it's ok, I got the EXP, who needs the gold."  LOL is all about collecting the gold, farming early game and buying what you want.  In the client, it's a grind of RNG! RNG is only satisfying if it's in your favor.  No one goes to a casino and loses all their money and say, "Well, that random slot machine that never paid was super fun, I'm going back tomorrow!"

If not, I'm left going "Wow ... a weeks of play ... for this?"  Before I got to see my IP raise and say "Sweet, in 2 days, I get to buy X."  THAT was satisfying.  Some times appearance is much more important then reality.

I'm simply saying, I'm the type of player who likes grey items.  "Sweet, this one is worth 2 gold!"

The new system feels very dissatisfying when I play well, get an awesome 3 player Gnar ult, die and my watch my team clean up with a 1 to 5  and see my screen go from grey to bright colors of victory.... just to get the the lobby and see .... XP.  

Look, when I reached level 30, it felt good.  Now ... there is no end.  There is literally no difference between level 30 to level 300, EXP simply translates into ... BE.  Yay, I have level 31, still can't play the new champion that came out, because I have to choose how to use my BE and portion it out between ... well ... everything!
They just need to bring back the feature of getting currency after a game instead of just solely EXP

But don't worry Riot promised we'd get the same amount of BE from these {{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

On average, you will be receiving the same or most likely more BE than you would have IP previously. Especially when you hit your 10 level caps where the rewards are more than usual. All the example math is [here](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/Jh3Mtzu6-board-post-title-blue-essence-earn-rates-learning-the-numbers-with-carl-and-henrietta).

Regarding your feedback on champ shards feeling random, that's fair, they are. And that sort of system isn't everyone's ideal experience. We're collating all community feedback off the back of this launch.

It should be some comfort to know that on average you're earning more BE than you would have IP previously, and shards can be activated for 40% less than the regular IP/BE store price. So shards off levels is more of a bonus when you get a shard you need, rather than the standard experience as you can just use your BE gains from disenchanting to buy champs in the store at a faster rate than previously anyway.

Here's the thing, i don't equate it to earning more, because if it's all in a milestone, then it's not earning more.

Not only that, hitting under average, is a normal thing to do, so short term, you can easily feel screwed by this system.

>When Henrietta hits level 39, she would have earned a total of ~8,381 IP in the old system. Now she'll have 6,480 blue essence (if every roll was bad which is 0.005%), 8,190 blue essence (the average rolls), or 11,160 blue essence (if every roll was perfect)

This is a non-casual, and on average you are earning less, fact is on 9 random rolls, some people are going to get less, some people are going to get more.

That isn't a rewarding system.

>When Henrietta hits level 40, she would have earned ~9,383 IP. Now she will have 8,460 blue essence (if every roll was bad which is 0.002%), 10,310 blue essence (the average rolls), or 13,380 blue essence (if every roll was perfect).

This is the culmanation of ~100 games, and you've only just POTENTIALLY caught up on IP/BE, that isn't more, that is actively less unless you score above average regularly.

It shouldn't take hitting a "milestone" to get the IP/BE i have earned through play.

I'd honestly rather the BE/IP was tuned down slightly, and we got BE/IP after every game, because at least that is giving me an amount that i can go "Ok so X more games and i can get Y" instead of "Ok, 5 more levels, and i'll hit a milestone and probably then finally have enough BE"

Okay lets really break this down. 

1. Why would they add this new system to the game? What would be the point of it.

This is easy to answer without going into the " RIOT WANTS MONEY FRAG EVERYONE!! " 
What they have done from a business point of view not consumers. Is to offer a product that wasn't needed nor wanted by the consumer. 
That is XP boost and IP boost.

Only time I have ever gotten either was when I got banned and leveling a new account. I would buy a 3 day XP boost and a 7 day IP boost. 
This would allow me to level a new account and have more then enough IP to get everything I need to enter rank and start all over again from where I left off. But in saying this after I achieved being able to join rank and so on I never looked at a IP boost or XP boost again.
I would just grind ARAM if I needed some fast IP to get a champion I wanted or join a few normal's with a mate and end games with 15 mins or so and go again. There was no need for any boost in anyway.

Now with the new system we have.. XP boost is more of must have thing. Sure you can grind out the levels going by Riot [here](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/Jh3Mtzu6-board-post-title-blue-essence-earn-rates-learning-the-numbers-with-carl-and-henrietta) but that is going the long way about it.

Where before hand. If you were 30 and only paid for skins.. What would be the point of XP boost or IP boost right? You are 30 and it is capped at 30 so really buying a XP boost would be a waste of money. IP Boost at 30 would be helpful some what but really not worth the money if you only play rank and not willing to grind normal's endlessly.

So removing the level cap and offering a reward and saying " Every 10 levels you get some epic stuff " this makes you more willing or even wanting of that XP boost to get to level 10 / 20 / 30 / 40 and so on. Just to see what epic stuff you get.

This creates another issue in it's self. No one I know has made it to 40 yet. I haven't seen any post about what you get at 40 or even 50. Then the other issue is when you hit 100.. Is that classified as really epic achievement? Do you get EPIC EPIC EPIC LOOTS!. Since so many of them are remaining unanswered it creates a lot of unknown.

Like before when I said I got 200 BE from 30 to 31. It was due to the champion I saw at the time of my uncertainty about the new loot system that a champion disenchant into 200 BE. Which I will say was very unnerving to me and I felt as thou I was ripped off for the work I did.

But this in it's self is becoming the most talked about issue on the forums. Even if I do the math and Riot does the math. The unseen out come of the new system and people seeing they got a capsule and they got 3 champions and then it disenchants for 810 BE { Which I just happen to me btw } people don't feel like they are being rewarded.
Even if you say " The maximum daily limit on IP was 900 " people see.. I could have gotten 900. Not 810 and then on top of that I have a chance to get 700.. I am worst off by 200 IP a day. 

This isn't really the best thing for this system right off the bat. You should have made it more rewarding at the start to allow people to get on board with it and said something like " Since it is a new system we have made it so you get better then normal loots. This is only for a limited time or until you get to level 35 after that the loot system will be based around this " 
That would help and allow people to understand the unseen part of it easier.

Lets face it. Riot loves chance. Every game you play is a game chance.. If you win or lose it is all chance. When I level a new account and buy some RP. The first thing I do is buy boxes. 
Normally 11 boxes sometimes I buy more. But I like to chance it on boxes because I am not worried about what I unlock as long as I feel I got my money's worth.

If I unlock boxes and all they have is skins and I cannot use any. I do not feel as thou I was ripped. I feel as thou it was a crappy box.
Come next week if I have enough cash left over after paying all the bills I will get another set of boxes.

BUT Capsules have a random aspect in which I did not choose. In fact it has been pushed upon me and taken away the ability to unlock champions until a set amount of time has past.
Sure you can speed this timer up by buying these gems. Sorry I was thinking of a mobile game just then... Hang on? No I am not. 

If I buy a XP boost.. I can speed up this timer between capsules and get bonus loot because I got 40 faster and so on. 
So from a customer point of view this is what is going on. League has become a mobile game.
Only difference is the fact I can play endless games and I don't have to wait out a timer before I get another life or so on to play the game again.
But I have a wait timer on when I can or cannot buy a champion unless I pay for the timer to be skipped.

2. Offering BE at the end of every game.

This can be good and bad. The first issue is how much BE is fair? Then the level up system would have to be removed or you get more BE then you should for input vs reward.
But if they only gave 25 BE every game you played for a win and 5 BE for loss we are back at the start again fighting over the new system and fairness.

I would like to see BE after every game. But I also like the leveling reward system. But once again it is the randomness of the capsules I do not like at all. 
The fact that capsules is the only way for me to get BE makes me worry more about BE then I ever worried about IP. This makes me worry about the value I get from the capsules. Sure I can buy the XP boost which Riot is hoping I will buy. Which { lets face it here} is a good business decisions but I just don't want to have to go that route to be able to achieve what I would achieve in the old system by seeing the growth of IP. 

But because I haven't gotten to 40 yet and because I haven't seen anyone showing what they have gotten at 40 I cannot really say what is needed or what isn't needed.
But I can say.. The randomness of the capsules are unwanted and something like a free champion pick needs to be added. You could add in the mystery champion shard for players that do like the random chance of this and that.. But something needs to be added to reduce the amount of unseen and chance's of the capsules.

But I am just a random player in league with my own idea on what should happen. What I think should or shouldn't happen doesn't always work out as a great business decisions.{{sticker:sg-lux-2}}

I wanna give an update on our plans. Right now we're working on another boards post where we'll reveal the full details of the new leveling curves and how it compares to the old system. Not just handpicked anecdotes, but charts showing the whole leveling curve for players of all types (average players, the top engagers, all that stuff). The post might take a couple of days at most to get out, because we're currently looking at some early tweaks we can make to address some of the feedback we've gotten. We'll talk about some of those in that post as well. I'll come back and update this post with a link to it once it's live. And obviously I'll keep posting here as I get the time. The reason we're here reading and engaging in all these posts is because we want to learn how players are reacting to the system. We knew stuff would be crazy (as it always is when you put a new system into the hands of millions of people) so this was always going to be the process. Y'all keep doing your thing, we'll follow up with official updates as soon as we can.
Thanks for all your patience.
